answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The normal kidney size of an adult human is about 10 to 13 cm (4 to 5 inches) long and about 5 to 7.5 cm (2 to 3 inches) wide. Renal size varies with age, gender, body mass index, pregnancy and co-morbid conditions like diabetes and hypertension. The renal size could be increased due to cysts or tumors.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: What causes kidneys to be enlarged when there are no blockages or stones?
title: Kidneys Slightly Larger Than Normal
